questions.prompt: Determine the $\small \textbf{magnitude}$ of the vector represented by the coordinates $(4,7)$ and $(-2,5)$.

questions.question: $\small \vec{u} = \begin{bmatrix}2\\-3\\5\end{bmatrix},\,\vec{v}= \begin{bmatrix}-4\\1\\-2\end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Calculate the $\small\textbf{dot product}$ of the following vectors

questions.question: $\small \vec{u} = \begin{bmatrix}1\\3\\2\end{bmatrix},\, \vec{v} = \begin{bmatrix}2\\-1\\4\end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Find the $\small \textbf{angle in degrees}$ between the following vectors:
questions.extra: Round to the nearest tenth (one decimal place). Do NOT include the degrees symbol

questions.question: $\small \vec{v} = \begin{bmatrix}2\\-1\\4\end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Find a $\small \textbf{unit vector}$ in the direction of $\small \boldsymbol{\vec{v}}$.

Two forces act on an object, one with a magnitude of $\footnotesize \textbf{20 newtons directly east}$, and another with a magnitude of $\footnotesize \textbf{15 newtons directly north}$. What is the $\footnotesize \textbf{magnitude}$ and $\footnotesize \textbf{direction}$ of the resultant force acting on the object? Round the angle to one decimal place (relative to the positive x-axis) and round the magnitude to the nearest newton.
questions.extra: Enter your answer as 'magnitude,angle' (e.g. 15,63.3) no spaces
